name: The Highball
description: Short of simply popping open a beer or a straight slug of whiskey, there are few drinks that are less labor-intensive than the venerable highball. With Labor Day this weekend, we figured this was the perfect drink to share. You could reasonably ask the question, "Do we really need a recipe for something so easy?" but while this simple (and flexible) mix of booze, bubbles and ice can be prepared with almost zero thought, a little care in the execution can make all the difference between a watery glass of meh and a damn refreshing drink.
recipeIngredient: 2 ounces liquor of choice: scotch, bourbon, rye, aged rum and brandy are all classics for a reason
2-6 ounces chilled club soda or ginger ale, to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a highball glass with ice. Add liquor, top with club soda or ginger ale or a combination of both. Do what comes natural.
